@Femi_Sorry @Telegraph No problem - but the ICJ only hears cases from State parties. The EU is not a state party so it can’t sue the UK there. Hope that reassures you.

@Femi_Sorry @Telegraph I respect your conviction, but this is muddled thinking.
Legally - we owe nothing close to £39bn (as the most snr govt legal advice made clear to me).
Politically - there’s no deal until whole deal.
Morally - we’d have far more respect refusing to give in to blackmail & bullying.

@Femi_Sorry @Telegraph Again: that was the negotiated settlement, as the blog site you quote makes clear, not applicable if no deal.

Which international court? On what jurisdictional basis?

@Femi_Sorry @Telegraph No it’s not. It’s a diplomatic settlement, premised on a deal.

Which international court, Femi? On what jurisidictional basis?
